subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 27 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Yeovil 0-2 Blackpool
Robbie Williams and Keigan Parker score as Blackpool beat Yeovil in the League One play-off final.



 
Lennon ruled out of England squad
Winger Aaron Lennon pulls out of the England squad to face Brazil and Estonia because of a twisted knee.



 
Lalas warns England over Beckham
General manager Alexi Lalas says LA Galaxy will not be happy if David Beckham is picked for inappropriate England friendlies.








GOLF




Hansen snatches victory from Rose
Anders Hansen edges a sudden-death play-off with Justin Rose to win the PGA Championship at Wentworth.



 
Verplank shares Crowne Plaza lead
Scott Verplank joins a six-way tie for the lead on a rain-affected day in Fort Worth.



 
Broadhurst and Fisher share lead
Ross Fisher birdies five of the last seven holes to join Paul Broadhurst at the top of the PGA Championship leaderboard.








MOTORSPORT




Alonso puts Hamilton in his place
Fernando Alonso beats McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton to win the Monaco Grand Prix and retake the championship lead.



 
As it happened: Monaco Grand Prix
Fernando Alonso triumphs for McLaren at the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Toseland's lead cut after crash
James Toseland finishes eighth behind Troy Bayliss after crashing at a wet Silverstone.








FORMULA ONE




Alonso puts Hamilton in his place
Fernando Alonso beats McLaren team-mate Lewis Hamilton to win the Monaco Grand Prix and retake the championship lead.



 
As it happened: Monaco Grand Prix
Fernando Alonso triumphs for McLaren at the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Alonso eclipses Hamilton for pole
Fernando Alonso edges out McLaren team-mate to pole position for Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Sotherton javelin costs her dear
Another woeful performance with the javelin sees Kelly Sotherton finish seventh in her first
heptathlon competition of the season.



 
Okoro wins 800m race in Holland
Marilyn Okoro clinches a thrilling 800m victory at the Thales FBK-Games in Hengelo, Holland.



 
Benjamin ready to launch comeback
British 400m runner Tim Benjamin is targeting a return to his best form under new coach Colin Jackson.








CYCLING




Ricco toils to mountain stage win
Saunier Duval rider Riccardo Ricco wins the gruelling 15th stage of the Tour of Italy.



 
Zabel admits to doping at Telekom
German cyclist Erik Zabel becomes the latest cyclist to admit to using banned blood booster EPO while competing for Telekom in the 1990s.



 
Luca regains Giro d'Italia lead
Italy's Danilo di Luca wins the 12th stage of the Giro d'Italia to take the overall leader's pink jersey.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Graham Poll gets his air guitar out as the Liverpool parade bus stays in the garage



 
Farewell West Jesmond
BBC Sport's adopted team look back on their season



 
Quotes of the Week
Lawro says what he thinks about the FA Cup final, plus Mourinho & Warnock
